user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is: A pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_create_response_from_buffer:
```c
_MHD_EXTERN struct MHD_Response *
MHD_create_response_from_buffer (size_t size,
                                 void *buffer,
                                 enum MHD_ResponseMemoryMode mode)
{
  if (MHD_RESPMEM_MUST_FREE == mode)
    return MHD_create_response_from_buffer_with_free_callback_cls (size,
                                                                   buffer,
                                                                   &free,
                                                                   buffer);
  if (MHD_RESPMEM_MUST_COPY == mode)
    return MHD_create_response_from_buffer_copy (size,
                                                 buffer);

  return MHD_create_response_from_buffer_with_free_callback_cls (size,
                                                                 buffer,
                                                                 NULL,
                                                                 NULL);
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
MHD_create_response_from_buffer_with_free_callback_cls (size,
                                                                   buffer,
                                                                   &free,
                                                                   buffer);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 8.13 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: Not violated: in this fragment the buffer argument is passed to the free callback (&free) (as the cls argument) so the callee will free/mutate that pointer. Because the pointer must be usable by free (which takes void *), it cannot be const-qualified here. If the buffer were only read by the callee and never freed/modified, it should be declared const void * (that would be a violation), but in this code const-qualification is not possible, so Rule 8.13 is not violated.
